name: FC - S - Roofing
Pre-installation checks
Scaffolding in place and tagged
Edge protection and safety nets installed
Correct Purlin / Steelwork heights
Correct Precast wall heights
Observations
Plywood Gutter Substrate
Plywood laid a minimum 0.5 degrees
Plywood surface smooth finish CD minimum 1.75mm H3 no knots
Plywood laid with 2mm gaps
Plywood fastened with stainless steel screws recessed 2mm
Outlets installed correctly 73-75mm above plywood
Observations
Steel Tray Substrate
Metal profile installed upside down with fastenings spaced correctly
Flashings installed on hips and valleys
Insulation protected from crushing (edge of gutter, timber edging, etc.)
Outlets framed and plywood routed out
Unused Roofing Iron Secured
Observations
Insulation panels
Sheets installed in brick-bond pattern
No gaps between sheets
Adhesive applied evenly and at correct amount
Sheets held down for correct length of time
Roof is confirmed uniform and flat
Observations
Membrane
Insulation panels are acceptable level of cleanliness
Membrane colour and thickness confirmed correct
Membrane penetrations have been sealed and are watertight
All welded seams and proprietary items to be seam probed
Observations
Inspections completed and issued to Foreman
CLICK AND SEND EMAIL TO FOREMAN TO SIGN FOR RECEIPT OF THE INSPECTION RESULTS
Handover Checklist
Area 100% completed and waterproof as per specification
Area left clean and tidy
Inform Viking and book completion inspection for FSW
Record of Building Work
Product Warranty
Pre-commencement checklist
Quality Management Plan Completed, Agreed & Attached
Inspection & Test Plan Completed, Agreed & Attached
Relevant Breakdown & Checklists Setup on Conqa & Reviewed by Main Contractor
Conqa Setup & Project Team Trained & Given Access
Review Access Granted to Main Contractor & Relevant Parties
Matrix/insights Setup (if required)
Membrane Checklist
Polyiso thoroughly cleaned and checked prior to priming or membrane application
Checked to ensure no dye-batch colour variation
Ensure the specified membrane thickness and colour is used on site
All products installed with a Viking Membrane comply with Viking Specifications e.g. the tested ‘system’ - Drains and accessories supplied by Viking Roofspec
All welded seams and proprietary items to be seam probed
Membrane installed as per spec and complete. Any general observations made
Warm Roof Checklist
Substrate
Area accessible
Edge protection and safety installed
Perimeter support installed if metal deck substrate
Substrate acceptable (clean, dry and stable)
Metcom7
Falls deemed acceptable by Council
Purlins and roof structure ready for Metcom 7 and approval given to lay
Who has given approval to lay
Fix steel to manufacturers specifications in compliance with NZBC
The metal profile installed upside down and the specified fastenings installed in the trough
Flashings installed on hips and valleys
Insulation protected from crushing (edge of gutter, timber edging, etc.)
The timber height is exact height of the insulation and the outside edge of the timber has a generous radius to ensure maximum bond of the membrane when dressed over it
Outlets framed and plywood routed out
Metcom7 installed as per spec and complete. Any general observations made
Polyiso
All Polyiso sheets butt jointed - np gaps created
Polyiso Sheets glued down with Viking FAST Adhesive (STP900B) using a proprietary dual cartridge caulking gun
STP900B adhesive applied in sweeping ribbons on every steel rib and then left to ‘foam-up’ over the next few minutes
Polyiso boards laid in a brick-bond pattern.
Butt the polyiso sheets up to the pre-formed timber edging where applicable
Entire roof inspected upon completion to ensure a uniform flat surface
Polyiso installed as per spec and complete. Any general observations made
Membrane
Polyiso thoroughly cleaned and checked prior to priming or membrane application
Checked to ensure no dye-batch colour variation
Ensure the specified membrane thickness and colour is used on site
All products installed with a Viking Membrane comply with Viking Specifications e.g. the tested ‘system’ - Drains and accessories supplied by Viking Roofspec
All welded seams and proprietary items to to be seam probed.
Membrane installed as per spec and complete. Any general observations made
Handover
Area 100% completed and waterproof as per specification
Request Review / Sign Off
Area left clean and tidy
Area complete and ready for FSW inspection
Report sent through to client
PS3s, warranties, user manuals and any other documents attached
